This seems to be the exact same problem Veronika had.  The fix is to configure 
the loader to recognize the necessary GTK libs.
Sorry, but how can i do that ?

You should look to find out which directory the actual GTK2 libs are in.  Then, 
make sure that place is included in the ld.so.conf.  Then, rerun ldconfig.

I don't understand what you wish.
I think, i too newbie on linux.

I use here SuSE 8.0 professionell with KDE 3.0, JDK 1.4 and the eclipse-version
for GTK2.
What i need do run they version with my linux-release ?

I have searched on my pc for files they starts with libgtk-
The following 2 files was founded, not more.
/usr/lib/libgtk-1.2.so.0
/usr/lib/libgtk-1.2.so.0.9.1

Where i must search for GTK2-libs and whats there names ?
Or do i must install anything ?
a simple rerun of /sbin/ldconfig doesn't helped

Ok, first step done: your libgtk files are in /usr/lib.
You have to look in the file /etc/ld.so.conf and see if there is a 
line "/usr/lib".  If not, add it and rerun ldconfig.

Thanks for the fast help.

I have add the line
/usr/lib
and rerun ldconfig
After that, i have start eclipse, but it still doesn't work.

I receive a error-message at run ldconfig, i'm not sure, is that a problem and
how i can fix the problem ?
Here the messages.

ldconfig: File /opt/gnome/lib/libgnomevfs-pthread.so is too small, not checked.
